trans-unit.source: Retrieves the amount of RAM that is physically installed on the computer

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the amount of RAM that is physically installed on the computer

target.mrk: Retrieves the amount of RAM that is physically installed on the computer

trans-unit.source: The amount of physically installed RAM, in kilobytes.

seg-source.mrk: The amount of physically installed RAM, in kilobytes.

target.mrk: The amount of physically installed RAM, in kilobytes.

trans-unit.source: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: The amount of memory available to the operating system can be less than the amount of memory physically installed

seg-source.mrk: The amount of memory available to the operating system can be less than the amount of memory physically installed

target.mrk: The amount of memory available to the operating system can be less than the amount of memory physically installed

trans-unit.source: in the computer because the BIOS and some drivers may reserve memory as I/O regions for memory-mapped devices,

seg-source.mrk: in the computer because the BIOS and some drivers may reserve memory as I/O regions for memory-mapped devices,

target.mrk: in the computer because the BIOS and some drivers may reserve memory as I/O regions for memory-mapped devices,

trans-unit.source: making the memory unavailable to the operating system and applications.

target.mrk: making the memory unavailable to the operating system and applications.

trans-unit.source: This function requires Windows Vista with SP1 or later.

seg-source.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista with SP1 or later.

target.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista with SP1 or later.
